Anyone still seeing this with the latest Mylar and Eclipse 3.3M6?  I can't reproduce.

Looks like a duplicate.  If not please reopen, but after running with -clean.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 168031 ***

Still seeing this on 3.3M6 with Mylar 2.0RC1 running with -clean on Linux-GTK.  This is with both the Sun and IBM J9 VMs, running on a Core Duo 2.5GHz machine.  

I've done some poking into this today, and found the deadlock being reported.  In a nutshell: the activators are doing too much, and ContextCorePlugin.lazyLoadExtensions() should be singled out in particular. 

Appended below is a highly filtered set of stack traces.  In them, you'll see four different stack traces from two worker threads, and a main thread.  The deadlock arises from the two worker threads:

One worker is processing the creation of lightweight decorators.
* context.ui apparently provides such a decorator.
* The creation of ContextUiPlugin causes its field ContextUiPlugin.colorMap to be initialized with an instance of context.ui.ColorMap.
* ColorMap has a static initializer assigning ColorMap.LANDMARK from a value in tasks.ui.TaskListColorsAndFonts.
* This causes tasks.ui to be activated.
* TasksUiPlugin.start() creates a tasks.ui.WorkspaceAwareContextStore, which inherits from context.core.AbstractContextStore.
* This causes context.core to be activated.

The other worker is processing early-startup:
* This causes the monitor.usage plugin to be started.
* The creation of MylarUsageMonitorPlugin initializes MylarUsageMonitorPlugin DATA_DIR_MOVE_LISTER to an instance of context.core.IContextStoreListener.
* This causes context.core to be activated, and an instance of ContextCorePlugin to be instantiated.
* ContextCorePlugin.start() calls ContextCorePlugin.lazyLoadExtensions()
* lazyLoadExtensions wanders over the extensions of org.eclipse.mylar.context.core.handlers
* one of these handlers is defined in tasks.ui
* this causes tasks.ui to be activated

This causes the deadlock.

The simplified and culled stack trace:

* as context.core's ContextCorePlugin.start() is calling lazyLoadExtensions(), which is activating other Mylar plugins, like tasks.ui, which are in turn trying to use values causing the activation of context.core.  But tasks.ui has been activated from another thread as part of creating lightweight decorators, which requires accessing the are being act


 require checking values from context.core, but context.core's ContextCorePlugin.lazyLoadExtensions() is causing This is similar to what's described in bug 131701.  

I'll file the full stack trace as a separate attachment.  But if you look at this heavily filtered stack trace, you'll see that the third thread

Created an attachment (id=62158)
workspace log showing deadlock

Log showing full gory detail.

Brian, thanks for the careful analysis, I'll reopen to investigate.  I realize that we do a lot on startup, but much of that is by design, and without rearchitecting we can only streamline that some.  So before I investigate, could you let me know what version of Mylar you reproduced this with?  Mylar 2.0RC1 is not until June, the current 3.3 dev build is 2.0.0.v20070327-2130.  Versions much earlier than that do not support 3.3M6 (e.g. Mylar 3.3M1).

> Mylar 2.0RC1 is not until June

Oops!  It was Mylar 2.0M1.  Because of these deadlock problems, I had to disable the Focused UI but otherwise haven't seen any issues under 3.3M6.  Will try a dev build tomorrow.

Will close for now since there were many incompatibilities and I know that some caused startup loading problems from other bugs.  Please reopen if you can reproduce.  That said I hate to lose your analysis so I have linked it from: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_Contributor_Reference#Debugging
Good news: just tried with Eclipse SDK 3.3M6 and Mylar dev build from 2.0.0.v20070328-2130 using several different workspaces and the problem doesn't appear.
Good to hear.  The problem was likely class loading failures that were triggering either a big slowdown or blocking a portion of our initialization.
